episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Post Mormon Parenting
episodes.description: What do you do when your mormon parenting handbook is tossed out the window? If you are a parent, and you have experienced a faith crisis, at some point you will have thoughts about how to parent your kids. Doesn't matter if they are little bitty or full grown with children of their own, you will have questions. First, it is totally understandable if you are having a hard time with this. You have been living in a black and white type of thinking world. It can feel very overwhelming to have that structure removed. There was not a lot of wiggle room before. Now what? Let's dive in to your mormon parenting brain and your post mormon parenting brain in this weeks episode of Exmormonology.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ How To Process Difficult Post Mormon Emotions
episodes.description: This week in Exmormonology we are going to walk towards our painful feelings. We have to be able to FEEL our feelings. Doing this lets the pressure, stress, and discomfort lessen. Once we are able to feel them properly, we can see that that emotion is just a physical vibration in the body and nothing to be scared of. Most of us spend so much time trying to avoid our negative feelings, at all costs, that we miss out on the growth that comes from processing our emotions. So, let’s show ourselves compassion and love and healing, by going there.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.description: Opps, we did it again! Another Irreverent Bonus Ep. of Exmormonology. Whiskey is involved and there is a lot of loud laughter. In this session James and I talk about.. The Regular Testimony Bearers Las Vegas Church Approved Music Black and White Thinking Jesus, The Bible and The Book of Mormon Things Lost In Translation Tithing Dollars White Lines and Stake Dances Thought Bubbles Happiness is Family Home Evening Champaign at a Family Dinner and more! Grab a drink, or not, and join us.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Post Mormon Decision Making
episodes.description: Growing up in the Mormon church, we have been so conditioned to black and white type of thinking. Black and white thinking effects our decision making. You may think you are "just bad at making decisions" but it is tied to your religious conditioning. You can do something about that. If you are a person who worries a lot about “doing it wrong” or “not good enough” or "afraid to mess up," this episode is for you. I have good news for you, there are no bad decisions, just decisions. Let's talk about it.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Mormons and Modesty and Garments
episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 32 is all about Modesty. Growing up, in and through mormonism, you have been influenced by all the lessens, scriptures, conference talks, parent messages and mormon culture, that comes with all the conditioning we experienced, even when we do not even see it as conditioning, while we are in it. We see it as normal. This is true for the conditioning we have experienced around modesty. We were taught that we, girls and women, are responsible for the thoughts boys/men may have about our bodies and how we dress. Mix religious conditioning and society messages and we have the perfect cocktail for messed up body image, shame and mental torture we put on ourselves, to hide ourselves. We spend so much time trying to make sure we are covered up, that we end up covering up our authentic self.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Hiking Half Dome and a Mormon Faith Crisis
episodes.description: Have you ever done something that scares the living day lights out of you? I know the answer is yes because I know you have experienced a faith crisis. Experiencing a faith crisis means you had to face fear and damnation and hell, face to face. Leaving the only belief you have ever know, is terrifying. Get yourself a new pair of gloves, hold on to the cables with all your might. You will come out the other side stronger than you ever thought possible. Listen to a tale of me facing my second, biggest fear, second only to my faith crisis. Half Dome and a tale about one of the 3 nephites, garments and porn shoulders.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Mormon Perfectionist Syndrome
episodes.description: Perfectionism! Ewwww. You may not even think you are a perfectionist and I am going to show you how perfectionism masks itself as doubt and how it may be stopping you from achieving what you want in life. We have lots and lots of layers to work through leaving the faith. This week we dive into the perfectionism we were constantly striving for and never attaining. I tell you why this happens and exactly how you can become a recovering perfectionist, like me. Let's dive in.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

Plus a few other tipsy wanderings that you don't want to miss.

episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 029 Your brain is the most powerful tool you have. Are you using it to your advantage or are you letting it run the show with no supervision? If you are serious about improving your exmormon mental health, have a listen. You are the boss of your brain, only you. No one else is responsible for what is going on up in the there, except for you. Spend some time mining around in there and see what is going on. You are worth the time. I give you concrete examples of what this looks like. This is your brain, this is your brain on exmormonism.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 28 We have been taught from a young age that we are responsible for other people's feelings, when in connection to something we have done or said. It can feel strange to learn that this is not true. People have thoughts and feelings based on their own life story and experiences. This week in Exmormonology let's talk about what I mean. Great nuggets are toward the end. Also, my new website is up! amyloganlife dot com.

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The Emotional Work of Racism
episodes.description: Your brain broke wide open during your faith crisis. You know how that felt, right? Let it break open again if you are new to racism. You know how to feel uncomfortable. You have done it, did it, as you process life after mormonism. Do it again with racism. If you are new to this work, pull the curtain back. Look. Be willing to see it all. This is one of the things I love so much about exmormons, we have felt betrayed by our religious past, this means you most likely want to see what other areas in your life you have not quite seen the full picture. Racism, for me, is one of those areas. How about you? Exmormonology Ep. 26.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Race and Mormonism and You

Yes, the mormon church has tried to lessen the teachings around "white and delightsome" and dark skin being a curse, but the truth of the matter is that this language is in the Book of Mormon. Let's talk about the how these teachings get into our psyche and influence our thoughts, feelings and actions around racism. Exmormonology Ep. 25.

episodes.title: Exmormon ology Ep#1 The Moment & My Mormon Faith Crisis
episodes.description:
#exmormon #postmormon #faithcrisis

My Exmormonology Podcast is up and running. I know that leaving mormonism can be very painful. Leaving any high demand religion can be difficult. 

Ever since I came to, after my mormon faith crisis, back in 2006, it has been my goal in life to help others who are walking the same path that I had to navigate, mostly on my own.

Exmormonology is the study of life after mormonism. Or any faith crisis, for that matter. My childhood religion just happened to be in mormonism, the church of jesus christ of latter day saints. When you leave your religion, life gets turned upside down for a bit. I call it free falling. 

If you can’t really figure out up from down right now, this podcast is for you. 

If you have been walking this path for awhile now, this podcast is for you. 

If you are ready to finally lay it all to rest, this podcast is for you. If you are on the hamster wheel of all things post mormon, this podcast is for you.

In this episode I talk about [The] Moment I knew the church was not TRUE for me.

What was your moment?

I also share a tool with you so you can start reframing your faith crisis.

~Amy

episodes.title: My Conversation with Crystal Escobar ~ Post Mormon Conversations
episodes.description:
#exmormon #postmormon #faithcrisis

I recently sat down with Crystal Escobar and chatted about her new book, her faith crisis and what she is up to know.  I hope you enjoy!

When Crystal Escobar first became a mom, she had a hard time figuring out the balance between being there for her kids and being there for herself. It’s the ultimate mom dilemma: “Am I a good mom if I have passions and interests outside of motherhood?” So many women can relate. They feel guilty about doing anything else outside of simply tending to their kids or their spouses, yet so many women today are finding themselves unfulfilled and stagnant in terms of their purpose.

There is an abundance of undiscovered talents just waiting to be shared with the world. Ask any woman what her life’s purpose is, and you will undoubtedly hear her respond with a phrase such as “I want to bless other people’s lives.” Finding your pas- sion and purpose is the spark that can ignite a raging fire of joy and enthusiasm within your life.

Crystal began exploring her own personal quest for pur- pose and balance in 2010. She learned to embrace her inner “mom-treprenuer” and used the blogging platform as a way to keep a personal journal of sorts. She found the time spent writing and sharing her thoughts with others to be extremely rewarding and even therapeutic. There were times she felt guilty for immersing herself into her work. There were times she felt inadequate and insecure while comparing herself to more established household-name bloggers. There were even times when she considered quitting all together, taking a two- year hiatus at one point.

This is a story of perseverance. Crystal’s blog has evolved into more than just an online journal; it has become a mission for her—a mission to create a community of other “wannabe balanced” moms who have the desire to become a better version of themselves in motherhood and business, all while juggling the other demands placed upon them. Crystal has been featured on several television news stations for her unique way of pro-moting a balanced life incorporating mind, body, and soul.

At the age of twenty-seven, Crystal and her husband, Sean, became the youngest-ever millionaires in Isagenix International, a multibillion-dollar nutrition and wellness company, and they retired by the age of thirty-five. Now they spend their time teaching and mentoring others along the same path, putting on yearly events, podcasting, and sharing their lives on Instagram and YouTube. This power couple continues to offer others valu-able insights on how you can make your dreams a reality.

Crystal Escobar

episodes.title: That is what you get for leaving the church.
episodes.description:
#exmormon #lifeaftermormonism #postmormon

Has anyone said to you...

"you would not be feeling that way if you had stayed in the church?"

It is a frustration statement. It is as if you hadn't left the church you would never be sad, angry, depressed, frustrated.

To that I say, that is not how this works.

That would mean that members can never have a bad day or an emotion other than complete joy, everyday, all day, all the time.

Just because you left the church, does not mean you have to fake having human emotions.

Navigating a faith crisis is a wild ride, at times. What you have been through is huge. It is painful, confusing, and catches you off guard. EVEN after you have come to terms with it. You may be totally happy and content with life most of the time and then every once and awhile you have a hard day. A day when you feel all the sad emotions, again.

It is okay. You get to feel that way. It does not mean you messed up. It means you are human.

ahhh, isn't that nice?

So, to those who say those types of things, let them, for they know not what they do or say. ;)

You got this!

If you are struggling, and want help moving on, I am here to coach you through it. I am a life coach and this is what I do. Work with me. I can help.

episodes.title: Mormon Missionaries & Calling Home
episodes.description:
#mormonmissionary #mormon #postmormon #lds

It is Tuesday, time for another video.

New guidelines for Mormon Missionaires. 

This post mormon momma with a son on a mission, has some opinions.

Missionaires can now call home, text, instant, message oh my!

I rant a bit around minute 6:16.

Yay for progress, but gezzzz, it is about damn time.

Allowing missionaires to be in more contact with their families is  healthy. This should have been a no brainer.

But, I believe the church is having a hard time with missionary retention rates and therefore......change of policy.

It used to be that the mormon church "felt" that missionaries needed to keep their focus on the lord and the work and talking with family would be a distraction.

Hmmm, mm okay.

Here are my thoughts.

I start with discussing the beginning of the religious conditioning that starts......way back at the beginning of life.

Enjoy!

Oh, and work with me!

episodes.title: Mormon Women and The Temple Veil ~ Post Mormon, Amy Logan
episodes.description:
#mormontemple #postmormon #exmormon

Leaving your religion is very complex, no matter the religion. 

I happen to be an exmormon and now I help others leaving their faith learn now to process this transition. It is multi-layered, for sure.

Dealing with changes the church makes as it grows and progresses can bring up all sorts of feelings for us. 

The Mormon church just changed a few things that happen in their temples. Women not needing to veil their faces is one of the changes.

I will be talking about it here.

I know this is a sensitive topic. I am treating it carefully and with respect even tho I show what the veil looks like. 

The church itself shows images of the temple clothing and because women are not required to wear the temple veil in the temple I feel it is okay to talk about.

Do not watch if this topic brings up too much for you. Just know that I am speaking to the issue of change and women and the church.

At about minute 3:30 I start coaching a bit.

Ready to work with me? amyloganlife@gmail.com

episodes.title: The You, After Mormonism ~ ExMormon ~ Amy Logan
episodes.description:
#postmormon #faithcrisis #lds

I think one of the most exciting parts of leaving religion, in my case mormonism, is finding your new voice.

What do you think now?

How do you want to show up in the world with your new world view?

How do you want to be?

Do you find yourself biting your tongue?

Are you okay with that?

What does your "new authentic self" even mean?

I seriously love helping guide my life coaching clients through this process. It is the most liberating thing I have to offer my people.

I want you to envision this.

You have left your faith. You are feeling really good about the decision to leave. Life is moving along just fine, but you know you are still, shying away from speaking out fully, or not even sure what that looks like.

Should you speak out?

How do you share your new thoughts and world view without fear of constantly being put down or brushed off?

Maybe you keep your mouth shut around family and friends because you are scared of judgement or fear of offending some one..

Good news. You can't offend anyone. It is their choice to be offended. (Send the offended party my way and I can coach them through that!) lol, no seriously!

Inevitably, you want to show up as your new self, with no fear of excessive judgment, right?

Well, guess what? You will be judged. You may loose friends. You may even make someone mad. 

The good news is that is all okay! Once you realize that that will happen, you can deal with it. Not everyone is going to leave and avoid you. Just those who were not really your friends anyway, right?

Now, I am not saying to go around trying to piss people off or even disrupt the flow of family and friends living their religion. They get to live their religion. That is their decision. But, showing up as your new self is totally okay. It can even be done with love and kindness. 

This is a beautiful process.

No more hiding the coffee maker and the wine. No more hiding your new world view. No more hiding that fact that you are not wearing garments. No more hiding that you no longer go to church. No more feeling scared to say you are agnostic or even atheist, if that is the path you have chosen. No more hiding period.

{{{{{ I could list a gazillion other things that you do not need to hide. But I think you get the point. }}}}}

My biggest point is that your new voice matters. It matters to you and to your children and even friends and family.

I have been amazed at the people who have messaged me, once I started speaking with my new voice, thoughts and opinions. People started to confide in my that they have been feeling the same way and felt/feel scared and not sure how to move forward.

Well, that is where I come in. I LOVE helping others navigate their way through this strange new world you are finding yourself in.

I would love to guide YOU through this process. I have a huge beautiful tool bag, full of ways to navigate this path.

It is so possible to step into your beautiful authentic self with confidence.

You got this.

Watching you step into your new self is one of the most rewarding things I have ever been a part of.

Amy xo ~

episodes.title: Amy Logan ~ Ex Mormon ~ To Remove Your Name or Not? ~ Faith Crisis Life Coach
episodes.description:
#mormon #faithcrisis #postmormon

I get asked questions all the time relating to the big issue of having your name removed from the LDS, Mormon church, or whatever they are calling themselves these days.

This can be a very difficult decision for so many. So many mormons have deep family roots with lots of lots of members and so the question arises, for some, to remove or not remove their name from the church records after deciding the church is not for you.

Many people, don't care at all and never have their name removed, because, they don't identify as mormon and who cares. Other people, like me, felt it was very liberating and empowering to have my name removed.

Then there are others who want to have their name removed, but because Grandma or Mom or Sister or Son or Daughter (you get my drift) may be mad or sad, they do not do it.

I always tell people that you are the adult and you get to make that decision, just like they are an adult and get to make the decision to be mormon. Grandma may get mad or be disappointed, but, she is a big girl and can deal. 

At the end of the day, it is all up to you, but I wanted to address it because so many of you message me about this topic.

So,  my two cents...

episodes.title: Life Coach ~ Amy Logan ~ Ex Mormon ~ Soul Searching Girl
episodes.description:
#postmormon #faithcrisis #workwithme

Okay my dear, I know you feel like your whole world just came crashing down on you. It feels heavy, scary, lonely.

I get it. 

I have been there, right where you are. Going through a Faith Crisis is one of the most confusing, painful experiences you have ever been through.

Feeling like you are the crazy one. Feeling like everyone is looking at you like you have lost your mind. Feeling scared to speak your mind. Feeling like you should just keep quiet to keep the peace.

You probably feel like you should hold it all in and just go through the motions of life, like it was before. Just pretend.

I did that for a long time too.

But you are probably tired of living that way. Tired of holding your tongue. Feeling like the new you is getting lost in the shuffle?

I am here to guide you through this process. 

I KNOW IT IS SCARY.

You are no longer the person you were. So how do you show up in the world now?

You can live in fear of the new you, or you can go find her!
 
I have a HUGE tool box, filled with all sorts of ways to help you, right now, in this scary place you have found yourself.

My dear, you will be okay. You will survive this. I promise.

Please do not let yourself get lost in this shuffle. You are needed. Your new voice is needed in the lives of your children, your spouse, your friends.

It is time to become the new you. It is totally okay to emerge as a new person.

Because, if you have been walking this awakening of yours for any amount of time, you know you cannot go back to the old way of being.

I have seen beautiful changes happen in the lives of my clients. I am always so honored to be a part of the process. I know it takes courage to let someone in. 

~Amy

As always, you can find me in many places on the interwebs...

episodes.title: Doubts & Polygamy ~ Soul Searching Girl ~ Exmormon
episodes.description:
This video was shot several months ago on a trip from Utah to Cali. I got talking about my doubts and this is part of what unfolded.

 I share this vlog with you as an insight to my thinking process and the connections I started making through my leaving the church mindset. Leaving mormonism is only part of my journey. But it was such a large part of my life that I still try to work through some of the conditioning and effects it has/had in my life.

I do not quote references and I do not even mention the TON of information available regarding Joseph Smith and polygamy. It was just a stream of thought. Enjoy.

episodes.title: Removing My Name ~ Soul Searching Girl ~ ExMormon
episodes.description: I felt like the mormon church had made enough decisions for me and I wanted to make the decision to have my name removed from the church records. It felt very good to make that decision. It has been a few years now and it still feels so good. I like starting from scratch! http://soulsearchinggirl.com/ Sign up on my site and receive my news letter.

episodes.title: Ex Mormon Girl on a Mission ~ The Poisonwood Bible ~ Soul Searching Girl
episodes.description: One of the books that started me down my paradigm shift. I do know the "why" to the question I pose in this video but really...why do we feel the need to do this? I believe there are many road that can be taken in this life. Not one that is straight and narrow. I prefer a road that has many twists and turns and goes all over the place. That is the road I will take. Check out my blog at www.soulsearchinggirl.com Sign up for my news letter. Join the conversation.
